dempred.datastructure

Class DatasetGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • dempred.datastructure.DatasetGenerator

  • public class DatasetGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that helps generating new datasets by merging, splitting...existing ones.

        public static <T extends Datapoint> java.util.List<Dataset<T>> generateDiverse(Dataset<T> dataset,
                                                               double cutoff)
        Generates a diverse dataset given a dataset.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the datapoints
        Parameters:
        dataset - the input dataset
        cutoff - the cutoff
        Returns:
        list which contains two datasets. The main dataset on index 0 and the fold dataset on index 1.

      • addBaseInfoOnly

        public static Dataset<Datapoint> addBaseInfoOnly(Dataset<Datapoint> dataset1,
                                 Dataset<?> dataset2)
        Adds all datapoints of dataset2 to dataset1. In contrast to add a new datapoint is created before adding which only contains some basic infos. These basic infos are: 'group, predictedGroup, value, predictedValue, weight, comment'. This function should be used if only these base infos are needed as it only needs few space. Since datapoints are copied before adding the original datapoints can be manipulated without affecting the added ones.
        Parameters:
        dataset1 - the input dataset1
        dataset2 - the input dataset2
        Returns:
        dataset1 extendet by all base infos of all datapoints of dataset2

      • split

        public static <T extends Datapoint> java.util.ArrayList<Dataset<T>> split(Dataset<T> dataset,
                                                          int number)
        Generates two new datasets by randomly splitting a given dataset at a predefined number.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        Parameters:
        dataset - the input dataset
        number - the number of datapoints the first dataset should have
        Returns:
        a list of two datasets. The first dataset contains 'number' datapoints and the second dataset contains all the rest

      • split

        public static <T extends Datapoint> java.util.ArrayList<Dataset<T>> split(Dataset<T> dataset,
                                                          double ratio)
        Generates two new datasets by randomly splitting a given dataset at a defined ratio
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset
        ratio - the ratio (0.0 - 1.0). e.g. 0.5 means that both datasets contain around 50% of the original dataset
        Returns:
        a list of two datasets. The first dataset contains 'ratio' datapoints and the second dataset contains '1.0-ratio' datapoints

      • getGroup

        public static <T extends Datapoint> Dataset<T> getGroup(Dataset<T> dataset,
                                        int group)
        Returns a new dataset which only contains datapoints of a single group.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        Parameters:
        dataset - the input dataset
        group - the group of returned datapoints
        Returns:
        dataset which only contains datapoints of a single group.

      • generateSubset

        public static <T extends Datapoint> Dataset<T> generateSubset(Dataset<T> dataset,
                                              FeatureSubset subset)
        Generates a new dataset which contains all datapoints from the original input dataset but only with a subset of features.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset
        subset - a feature subset
        Returns:
        a dataset which contains all datapoints from the original input dataset but only with a subset of features.
